com.google.android.exoplayer.chunk

Interface ChunkSource

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DashMp4ChunkSource, DashWebmChunkSource, MultiTrackChunkSource, SmoothStreamingChunkSource

    public interface ChunkSource
    A provider of Chunks for a ChunkSampleSource to load.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • getTrackInfo

        TrackInfo getTrackInfo()
        Gets information about the track for which this instance provides Chunks.

        May be called when the source is disabled or enabled.

        Returns:
        Information about the track.

      • getMaxVideoDimensions

        void getMaxVideoDimensions(MediaFormat out)
        Adaptive video ChunkSource implementations must set the maximum video dimensions on the supplied MediaFormat. Other implementations do nothing.

        Only called when the source is enabled.

      • enable

        void enable()
        Called when the source is enabled.

      • disable

        void disable(java.util.List<? extends MediaChunk> queue)
        Called when the source is disabled.
        Parameters:
        queue - A representation of the currently buffered MediaChunks.

      • continueBuffering

        void continueBuffering(long playbackPositionUs)
        Indicates to the source that it should still be checking for updates to the stream.
        Parameters:
        playbackPositionUs - The current playback position.

      • getChunkOperation

        void getChunkOperation(java.util.List<? extends MediaChunk> queue,
                     long seekPositionUs,
                     long playbackPositionUs,
                     ChunkOperationHolder out)
        Updates the provided ChunkOperationHolder to contain the next operation that should be performed by the calling ChunkSampleSource.

        The next operation comprises of a possibly shortened queue length (shortened if the implementation wishes for the caller to discard MediaChunks from the queue), together with the next Chunk to load. The next chunk may be a MediaChunk to be added to the queue, or another Chunk type (e.g. to load initialization data), or null if the source is not able to provide a chunk in its current state.

        Parameters:
        queue - A representation of the currently buffered MediaChunks.
        seekPositionUs - If the queue is empty, this parameter must specify the seek position. If the queue is non-empty then this parameter is ignored.
        playbackPositionUs - The current playback position.
        out - A holder for the next operation, whose ChunkOperationHolder.queueSize is initially equal to the length of the queue, and whose ChunkOperationHolder.chunk is initially equal to null or a Chunk previously supplied by the ChunkSource that the caller has not yet finished loading. In the latter case the chunk can either be replaced or left unchanged. Note that leaving the chunk unchanged is both preferred and more efficient than replacing it with a new but identical chunk.

      • getError

        java.io.IOException getError()
        If the ChunkSource is currently unable to provide chunks through getChunkOperation(java.util.List<? extends com.google.android.exoplayer.chunk.MediaChunk>, long, long, com.google.android.exoplayer.chunk.ChunkOperationHolder), then this method returns the underlying cause. Returns null otherwise.
        Returns:
        An IOException, or null.

      • onChunkLoadError

        void onChunkLoadError(Chunk chunk,
                    java.lang.Exception e)
        Invoked when the ChunkSampleSource encounters an error loading a chunk obtained from this source.
        Parameters:
        chunk - The chunk whose load encountered the error.
        e - The error.
